contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=October 2012}} {{Infobox Australian place | type = suburb | name = Reservoir | city = Melbourne | state = vic | image = | caption = | lga = City of Darebin | postcode = 3073 | coordinates = {{Coord|37|42|47|S|145|0|43|E|region:AU-VIC_type:city|display=inline,title|name=Reservoir, Victoria}} | pop = 47,637 (2011)<ref name="abs">{{Census 2011 AUS | id = SSC21139 | name = Reservoir (State Suburb) | accessdate = 1 July 2011 | quick = on}}</ref> | area = 19.1 | est = | stategov = [[Electoral district of Preston|Preston]], [[Electoral district of Thomastown|Thomastown]] | fedgov = [[Division of Batman|Batman]] | dist1 = 12 | location1= [[Melbourne city centre|Melbourne]] | dist2 = | location2= | near-nw = [[Campbellfield, Victoria|Campbellfield]], [[Thomastown, Victoria|Thomastown]] | near-n = [[Thomastown, Victoria|Thomastown]] | near-ne = [[Bundoora, Victoria|Bundoora]] | near-w = [[Fawkner, Victoria|Fawkner]] | near-e = [[Kingsbury, Victoria|Kingsbury]] | near-sw = [[Coburg North, Victoria|Coburg North]] | near-s = [[Preston, Victoria|Preston]] | near-se = [[Heidelberg West, Victoria|Heidelberg West]] }} '''Reservoir''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|r|ɛ|z|ə|v|ɔr}}, locally {{IPA|[[Australian English phonology|[ˈɹezəvoː]]]}}) is a suburb of [[Melbourne]], [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]], [[Australia]], 12 km north of Melbourne's [[Melbourne City Centre|Central Business District]]. Its [[Local government areas of Victoria|local government area]] is the [[City of Darebin]]. At the [[Census in Australia#2011|2011 Census]], Reservoir had a population of 47,637. Reservoir is an established suburb with standard brick homes, weatherboard homes, and an increasing number of new developments. The region contains popular recreation areas and facilities, including Edwardes Lake and the Reservoir Leisure Centre, and is home to the Edwardes Street and Broadway shopping strips. ==History== Reservoir Post Office opened around 1921.<ref name = "PostOffice">{{Citation | last = Premier Postal History | title = Post Office List | url = https://www.premierpostal.com/cgi-bin/wsProd.sh/Viewpocdwrapper.p?SortBy=VIC&country= | accessdate = 11 April 2008 }}</ref> ==Overview== Reservoir is close to the [[Northland Shopping Centre]], Preston Market, [[Sydney Road, Melbourne|Sydney Road]] shops and restaurants and one of three remaining drive-in cinemas in Melbourne, the [[Village Roadshow|Village]] in [[Coburg, Victoria|Coburg]]. The area is experiencing unprecedented growth, with plenty of new developments. It is also very popular with young home-buyers looking for a 'still affordable' inner city lifestyle.{{Citation needed|date=June 2010}} The area is serviced by four railway stations: [[Reservoir railway station|Reservoir]], [[Regent railway station|Regent]], [[Keon Park railway station|Keon Park]], and [[Ruthven railway station|Ruthven]] and many [[List of Melbourne bus routes|bus routes]]. The [[Melbourne tram route 112|West Preston tram route]] also ends at the south end of the suburb. Reservoir is located 12 km north of the Melbourne CBD, with easy access to the [[Western Ring Road|Northern/Western Ring Rd]], [[Hume Highway|Hume Highway/Freeway]], [[Tullamarine Freeway|Tullamarine]] & [[Calder|Calder Freeway]]s and [[Eastern Freeway, Melbourne|Eastern Freeway]]. ==Sport== * [[Reservoir Football Club]] and [[West Preston Football Club]] are [[Australian Rules football]] teams. Both competes in the [[Northern Football League (Australia)|Northern Football League]].<ref name = "footy">{{Citation | last = Full Points Footy | title = Northern Football League | url = http://www.fullpointsfooty.net/diamond_valley_football_league.htm | accessdate = 15 April 2009 }}</ref> *Preston Lions Soccer Football Club play in the [[Victorian Premier League]]. Victorian cricketer [[Ray Harvey]] lives in Reservoir. ==See also== * [[City of Preston (Victoria)|City of Preston]] - the former local government area of which Reservoir was a part ==References== {{Reflist}} {{City of Darebin suburbs}} [[Category:Suburbs of Melbourne]]
